reference.shortdesc: An anchor is an integration point in a DITA map. Another map can reference the anchor in order to insert a navigation structure into the map that contains the anchor.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: The anchor element typically is used to allow integration of run-time components. Another map can reference the anchor by using an anchorref element. This enables the navigation structure of a map or map branch to be inserted at the location of the anchor.

section.title: Processing expectations
section.p: The mechanism by which processors discover maps to be anchored is processor specific.

section.title: Attributes
section.p: The following attributes are available on this element: .
For this element, the id attribute is required. It is referenced by the anchorref element or by the anchorref attribute on the map element.

example.title: Example
example.p: The following code sample shows a DITA map that contains an anchor element with an id attribute set to a1:
example.codeblock: <map> <title>MyComponent tasks</title> <topicref href="start.dita" toc="yes"> <navref mapref="othermap2.ditamap"/> <navref mapref="othermap3.ditamap"/> <anchor id="a1"/> </topicref> </map>
